page.title: 11TOWN TWINNING
page.content: Hillingdon is linked with the towns of Emden and Schleswig in West Germany and with Mantes-la-jolie in France. Mantes and Schleswig were first linked with Hayes and Harlington in 1958 and Emden with Uxbridge 3 years later. The 3 continental towns were twinned with the Borough of Hillingdon on its formation in 1965. In Hillingdon French and German is taught in many schools and further education classes encourage adults to take up this new interest. Many exchange visits with schools have taken place between Hillingdon and its twin town over a number of years. Educational and youth visits in particlar have proved exteremely popular but there are many other exchanges which will be involving adults.
